tasks: Write a clear and concise explanation of the Aesthetic-Usability Effect (lawsofux.com) on your blog or Medium, including examples and scenarios. Share with your network. Score improvement: +2% in Collaboration & Communication

Collaborate with a peer or mentor on a simple design challenge, such as redesigning a button style using the Law of Proximity (lawsofux.com). Share your process and feedback. Score improvement: +5% in Collaboration & Communication

Write a clear and concise explanation of the Law of Proximity (lawsofux.com) on your blog or Medium, including examples and scenarios. Share with your network. Score improvement: +5% in Collaboration & Communication

Collaborate with a peer or mentor on a complex design challenge, such as redesigning an entire website using the 8-point grid system. Share your process and feedback. Score improvement: +10% in Collaboration & Communication

resources.readup: As an Explorer UX designer, you have the unique opportunity to uncover new insights and design solutions that transform user experiences. To excel in this role, focus on developing a strong foundation in UX fundamentals, collaborating with cross-functional teams, and continuously refining your skills in research, visual design, and product thinking.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Understanding Usability Heuristics for UI Design
topics.summary: Exploring usability heuristics will help you identify and address common design pitfalls, improving your overall UX design skills.
practice_points: Analyze 5 existing websites using the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design and document areas for improvement
Create a comprehensive guide to usability heuristics, explaining each principle with examples and counterexamples
Develop a set of actionable design recommendations based on the 10 Usability Heuristics, tailored to a specific product or service

topics.name: Applying Cognitive Biases in UX Design
topics.summary: Learning about cognitive biases will enable you to design more intuitive and user-friendly products, reducing the impact of these biases on your designs.
practice_points: Conduct 2 interviews using the Zeigarnik Effect framework to understand how users remember unfinished tasks
Create a list of common cognitive biases in UX design, with examples and explanations
Develop a set of best practices for mitigating cognitive biases in your own designs

topics.name: Crafting Effective UI Design Systems
topics.summary: Mastering UI design systems will help you create cohesive, scalable, and maintainable designs that align with your product's goals.
practice_points: Design a comprehensive style guide for a fictional product using the Aesthetic-Usability Effect principles
Create 3 interactive prototypes in Figma showcasing different design system variations, including typography, color, and spacing tokens
